item.title: Queensland man charged with selling stolen sheep.

item.title: Alleged sheep rustler charged in southern Queensland
item.description: A 69-year-old man has been charged after allegedly stealing 880 sheep and selling them through a saleyard.

item.title: Victorian coroner to reopen investigation into 2011 death of Louisa Ioannidis
item.description: New evidence reopens a coronial investigation into the death of a 24-year-old woman whose body was found in a river in Melbourne's north in 2011.

item.title: Questions raised after key election pledge TasInsure fails to appear in Tasmanian budget
item.description: There were hats, jackets and a shop front, but when it came to budget day, there was no money set aside for the creation of TasInsure, which the Tasmanian Liberals promised would save households up to $250 a year during the election.

item.title: Former Neighbours star Damien Richardson found guilty of public Nazi salute
item.description: Former Neighbours star Damien Richardson performed an illegal Nazi salute in public but was not intending to display loyalty to Adolf Hitler, a magistrate says.

item.title: Former Australian captain Mark Taylor tells Sam Konstas to ditch ramp shots in bid to earn Test recall
item.description: The former Australian captain believes it is time for the talented opener to go back to basics as he finds himself on the outer as the Ashes begin.

item.title: Chinese-made electric buses on Australian roads spark cybersecurity concerns after Norway flags issue
item.description: The same Chinese company that makes electric buses now under review in Denmark and Norway also has electric buses on Australian roads.

item.title: Friday finance with Daniel Ziffer
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Father-of-five sentenced to life behind bars for stabbing murder of wife in remote NT community
item.description: In sentencing the man to life behind bars on Friday, the Northern Territory Supreme Court's highest judge described the victim's death as a "profound tragedy".

item.title: Elena Anita Begovic pleads guilty to negligent driving causing death of Marshall Oakley-Stagg
item.description: Marshall Oakley-Stagg died after being struck by a car outside in Hobart's northern suburbs last year.

item.title: Perth man charged with sending sexualised messages to '14-year-old boy' then meeting at shopping centre
item.description: A 31-year-old Riverton man appears in court after allegedly sending sexualised messages to two teenagers pretending to be a 14-year-old boy and then arranging to meet in Perth's north.

item.title: Kangaroos defeat Hawks by 39 points in first AFLW qualifying final
item.description: North Melbourne registers its 25th consecutive win with a 39-point drubbing of Hawthorn in the first AFLW qualifying final.

item.title: Woman convicted in UK of harassing Maddie McCann's parents, but acquitted for stalking
item.description: Prosecutors said there was "unequivocal scientific evidence" Julia Wandelt had no familial link to the McCanns.

item.title: A letter to Anthony Albanese could allow Labor MPs to speak up on gambling reform
item.description: Andrew Wilkie has asked the PM to allow a free vote on banning gambling advertising and it appears many Labor MPs would support it.

item.title: Europe's support is more important than ever as Trump checks out on Ukraine
item.description: European leaders now feel a very existential threat from Russia but it seems their own problems at home are constraining them from doing anything about it.

item.title: While Australians feel the pressure to buy a home this Austrian city embraces lifelong renters
item.description: Experts say the government should be looking to examples in countries where more social and affordable housing options are being developed.

item.title: Country Fire Service prepares for summer season with smoke but no fire
item.description: Ahead of bushfire season, the SA Country Fire Service's air operations teams clear out the cobwebs and take to the skies to simulate bushfires in the Flinders Ranges.

item.title: Hawks faced with fresh injury concerns after loss to Kangaroos in AFLW qualifying final
item.description: Injury-ravaged Hawthorn is counting the cost of its heavy loss to North Melbourne in the opening AFLW qualifying final.

item.title: Spring see-saw weather brings heat, storms and snow to eastern Australia
item.description: Australia's weather has been highly volatile during the past fortnight, and this weekend will serve up another smorgasbord of atmospheric variability.

item.title: Bilpin apple grower fears mystery failed crop could be linked to varroa mite
item.description: Across the Blue Mountains, apple farmers are noticing less fruit this season. Some are wondering if it's linked to varroa mite.

item.title: Unsettled weather forecast for Queensland with thunderstorms north-west to south-east
item.description: Storms are expected across a large part of inland Queensland, with the Darling Downs region set to cop another weekend of severe weather.

item.title: In Melbourne's west, residents say street violence has 'come to their door'
item.description: Five young people have died due to knife violence in two and a half years in the Melbourne suburb of Melton. Residents fear the situation is "out of hand".

item.title: Hundreds of US flights cancelled as government shutdown drags on
item.description: With politicians in a bitter stand-off over spending priorities, Congress has ground to a standstill.

item.title: One Piece defines gen Z protests from Madagascar to Indonesia
item.description: Youth demonstrations in Madagascar are the latest in a number of gen Z protests across parts of Asia, Africa and South America, and young people are galvanised to join some of the largest protests of their generation.

item.title: US, UK lift sanctions on Syrian president Ahmed al-Sharaa after UNSC decision
item.description: The United States and Britain remove sanctions on Syrian President Ahmad al-Sharaa, a day after the United Nations Security Council did the same.

item.title: England's Football Association bans Milutin Osmajić for nine matches over racial abuse
item.description: Montenegro striker Milutin Osmajić is suspended for nine matches for racially abusing an opponent during a match in England's second-tier Championship last season.

item.title: How colourism and social media abuse have roiled Pacific beauty pageants
item.description: Beauty pageants remain serious business in the Pacific, but contestants are thinking twice before entering due to online bullying and discrimination.

item.title: Private health insurance offered little relief for my dental woes
item.description: Do I walk away from private insurance and trust that health challenges will have me seen promptly enough in the public system?

item.title: James Watson, co-discoverer of DNA's double helix, dead at 97
item.description: James Watson, the controversial American biologist whose 1953 discovery of the structure of DNA ushered in the age of genetics, has died.

item.title: Mildura council aims to take Melbourne's controversial Yellow Peril art in new tourism campaign
item.description: Mildura Rural City Council says it wants Melbourne's Yellow Peril art piece to be moved to the regional centre as part of a new tourism campaign.

item.title: Diagnosis of gestational diabetes rises 70 per cent in five years, linked to pregnant woman's age and weight
item.description: One in five pregnant women are diagnosed with the condition, which experts say is linked to age, weight and a lack of exercise.

item.title: Elon Musk’s win at Tesla shareholder meeting causes worry to some
item.description: The world's richest man's believers have once again agreed to enrich the Tesla boss to levels far beyond the realm of ordinary billionaires. But how much is enough?

item.title: They dared to believe and now this amateur English cricket club is taking on Gambia
item.description: Dodgy souvlaki, forgotten bails, and schoolboy defeats — even so, this unlikely group of amateurs are off to play in Gambia.

item.title: Feral cat eradication on Christmas Island clashes with Malay culture
item.description: On a speck of land in the Indian Ocean, one of the world's most ambitious wars is being waged against feral cats. But not everyone is celebrating.

item.title: Aryna Sabalenka to face Elena Rybakina in WTA Finals title decider
item.description: World number one Aryna Sabalenka books a showdown with Elena Rybakina, with both players eyeing off their first season-ending championship win.

item.title: A look at the legacy of Salt-N-Pepa, who will be inducted into the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame
item.description: Salt-N-Pepa will this weekend be inducted into the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame in the musical influence category. The group, founded in 1985, has had a huge impact on popular music and culture.

item.title: Albury's Macquarie Textiles celebrated for decades of manufacturing
item.description: Textile manufacturing took Albury's work to the Opera House, federal parliament, the Olympics and beyond.

item.title: Compromise on WA's GST deal not an option, Treasurer Rita Saffioti says
item.description: When it comes to Western Australia's slice of the GST pie, the state government is making no apologies for ruffling the feathers of other jurisdictions.

item.title: The first Wright Brothers invented the airplane, but these two are creating comics for kids
item.description: When boys write their own comics, they are bound to be full of fart jokes, stinky-eyed butt dragons and lots of crazy superpowers.

item.title: This punchy olive and feta salad will lift any meal - ABC News
item.description: With a mix of marinated olives, red onion, capsicum and creamy feta, tossed with fresh herbs and a zesty lemon-garlic dressing, this salad pairs perfectly with grilled meats, seafood or a mezze spread.

item.title: Queensland Health reviews Gold Coast mental health service after youth suicides
item.description: The review comes after the suicides of two young people in the past five years who received treatment at the service in Robina.

item.description: Amyl and the Sniffers, Tame Impala and Rüfüs Du Sol will represent Australia at the 68th Annual Grammy Awards next year. Here is the full list of nominees.

item.title: Kangaroos focus on 'wonderful opportunity' in final Ashes Test against England at Headingley
item.description: The Kangaroos may hold an unassailable 2-0 lead in the Ashes series, but they have not been completely satisfied with their performances in England.

item.title: Police officer stabbed with sword in Grasmere, man charged with attempted murder
item.description: Andrea Surache allegedly threw a spear at police officers before stabbing a probationary constable in the leg with a sword in Sydney's south-west.

item.title: Calls for better safety awareness after drowning at Margaret River surfing mecca
item.description: Sean Lennon was a trained lifeguard who spent years surfing Margaret River's iconic surf breaks. His death earlier this week has sparked calls for better safety from the broader surfing community.

item.title: Inquest hears of communication breakdown between corrections, health staff before death in custody
item.description: A coronial inquest into the death in custody of a Darwin prisoner has heard prison officers ignored concerns about the "comatose" man being placed alone in a cell.

item.description: There has been a massive surge in the number of discarded syringes being collected from the streets of Kalgoorlie-Boulder, with more than 5,323 so far this year.

item.description: With sacred springs and water holes in northern WA drying up, the WA government decides to relocate where it is extracting groundwater from.

item.description: A new addition to Kelingking Beach has locals and tourists in an uproar, deeply dividing many along Bali's tested fault line — development versus environmental conservation.

item.title: Fairlie Arrow abduction hoax: Why the Gold Coast singer faked her own kidnapping

item.description: Shanice Parker is the daughter of a Jillaroos World Cup player, but meeting her biological father as a teenager has prompted her to represent New Zealand.

item.description: Rising house prices and lower incomes due to caring for children can make it especially difficult for women to re-enter the housing market after a divorce.

item.description: WA's consumer watchdog says scams are getting more sophisticated and cheaper to make, as an AI video of state premier Roger Cook sparks new concerns.

item.description: Typhoon Kalmaegi left hundreds dead and as Filipinos are bracing for more extreme conditions as they mourn their loved ones and pick up the pieces.

item.title: Health authorities issue a nationwide recall of various alfalfa sprouts due to salmonella outbreak
item.description: Salmonella symptoms usually start six to 72 hours after exposure to the bacteria and usually last for four to seven days.

item.title: Carlton beats West Coast by 41 points in AFLW elimination final at Princes Park
item.description: Carlton stuns West Coast with a dominant AFLW finals win, as Mia Austin honours her late cousin Ben with an emotional goal at Princes Park.

item.description: A neo-Nazi rally outside the NSW parliament on Saturday morning was deemed "authorised" because police had chosen not to oppose the public assembly.

item.description: Stormy weather ensures only 4.5 overs are bowled in the fifth and final T20 match between Australia and India in Brisbane.

item.description: The two-day talks were the third round of peace negotiations between the countries.

item.description: The Kangaroos have secured a 3-0 Ashes victory with Harry Grant leading the way in a big win over England at Headingley.

item.description: The Wallabies slump to consecutive defeats on their spring tour, as Italy comes from behind to win in Udine.

item.title: How the dismissal of Gough Whitlam's Labor government in 1975 was sealed by the Senate
item.description: Before Gough Whitlam's dismissal and famous speech on the steps of Parliament House, there was silence — and strategy — in the Senate. This is the inside story of how a budget stand-off changed Australian democracy forever.

item.description: Behind the quirks of Australia's incredible democratic system are a series of complex human backstories.

item.description: Golf has a reputation for being expensive and exclusive — but on this island in Bass Strait, things are a bit more relaxed.

item.description: Elena Rybakina has defeated world number one Aryna Sabalenka to win the season-ending WTA Finals, 6-3, 7-6(0).

item.description: Zohran Mamdani's victory in Tuesday's New York City mayoral election looked unlikely at one point. Polling shows it was women who helped power him into office.

item.description: After reading Die My Love in book club, Martin Scorsese knew it had to be made into a film. Now it's rewriting cinema's portrayal of womanhood and postpartum depression.

item.description: The new regulations would bring Tasmania into line with national standards, but smaller growers are worried they will have to pay the same fees and meet the same auditing requirements as large-scale growers.

item.description: A Victorian inquiry has found a dismissive and disrespectful healthcare system centred around men is contributing to poorer outcomes for women and girls.

item.description: An exhibition exploring Western Australia's food history in all its guises, including its fast-food pioneers, is on show at the State Library.

item.description: Police are investigating witness reports of a single gunshot heard near Dezi Freeman's property shortly after he allegedly killed two police officers in August.

item.description: Drivers on regional roads are being warned of an increase in kangaroo activity on South Australian roads, with large mobs of roos seen lining roads at dawn and dusk, creating growing safety concerns for road users.

item.description: Labor party members call for hydraulic fracturing, or fracking, to be banned across the whole of WA.

item.title: Firefighters battle out-of-control blaze in New Zealand national park
item.description: Fire and Emergency New Zealand says an out-of-control wildfire in Tongariro National Park has swelled in size to about 1,000 hectares, leading to the evacuation of dozens of hikers.

item.description: A series of missteps shows the theft in the Louvre was far from a sleek operation. Instead, French authorities believe petty criminals executed it.

item.description: A man in police custody since a crash killed a woman, 30, and a girl, 10, in the Queensland community of Doomadgee has been confirmed as the partner of the woman and father and stepfather of the children in the vehicle.

item.description: There is no road map for step-parenting, and experts say a common mistake is assuming it will be easy.

item.title: AFLW finals: Brisbane Lions beat Melbourne by 13 points to reach prelim final, Adelaide beats St Kilda
item.description: Brisbane defeats Melbourne for the first time in AFLW finals, as the Lions win on the road to clinch a preliminary final spot, and Adelaide ends St Kilda's season.

item.title: Australia beats New Zealand 40-8 to defend Women's Pacific Cup crown
item.description: Julia Robinson scores twice as Australia defeats New Zealand 40-8 to claim a second consecutive Pacific Cup in emphatic fashion.

item.title: Cook Islands qualify for Rugby League World Cup, beating South Africa 58-6 in Sydney
item.description: Cook Islands book their spot in a fourth Rugby League World Cup, turning it on to beat South Africa 58-6 in Sydney.

item.description: NSW Police should have gone to court to stop a neo-Nazi stunt outside Parliament House, Opposition Leader Mark Speakman says.

item.title: Coverage of embattled Perth builder, WA's 'most vulnerable child', among award-winning journalism

item.description: The police union calls for Canberra's city watch house to be condemned and a new one built after faulty sewerage forced the site to be temporarily closed.

item.title: From jackaroo to 'Golden Tonsils' radio titan: the life and career of John Laws
item.description: John Laws, also known as "Golden Tonsils", spent a mammoth 71 years on air at stations such as Sydney's 2UE and 2SM, before retiring in November 2024.

item.description: Oscar Piastri's Formula 1 title challenge has taken another blow, with a controversial penalty costing the Australian in Brazil.

item.description: Unpaid federal workers are turning to food banks and draining their savings as the longest US government shutdown in history drags on.

item.description: Foreign-owned aquaculture company Tassal suffers a fish kill at its barramundi farm in WA's Cone Bay, where the company has plans to expand.

item.title: Renewable energy 'spilled' as generation outgrows demand
item.description: Mountains of clean power are regularly "wasted" as Australia's energy system evolves. But a large amount of battery storage is waiting in the wings, ready to soak it up.

item.title: Replacing Sussan Ley as Liberal leader isn't an easy fix to the party's problems
item.description: As the federal Liberal Party embarks on more self-harm over climate change policy this week, the idea seems to have set in among some that tearing down its first ever female leader could be a low-consequence affair.

item.title: Are Australia and its rare earths part of the solution to 'magnet shock'?
item.description: Anyone who controls the supply of magnets controls the future, and China has been quietly working on this under America's nose for decades. Can Australia muscle in?

item.description: It is almost crunch time for Australia to secure hosting rights for the next COP meeting, so it is timely to examine why the government's bid is languishing and how it can resolve a long-running stand-off with Türkiye.

item.title: Beyond the Box showcases Australian artists using cardboard to create art
item.description: Artists have been using cardboard for at least a century to create works. These Australians showcase how the humble medium can be transformed into striking sculptures and collage.

item.description: AFL teams ranked ninth and 10th will be in contention to win the premiership from next season, with the league introducing a wildcard round.

item.description: ANZ has posted a 10 per cent slide in net profit to $5.9 billion but a bounce in its shares drove the ASX higher.

item.title: Respected engineer sounds alarm on extent of defective Darwin apartment buildings
item.description: A respected consulting engineer says about 80 per cent of apartment buildings he has inspected in Darwin have serious structural issues.

item.title: Wallabies 'not looking for excuses' after defeat to Italy
item.description: Wallabies coach Joe Schmidt says his weary charges must toughen up rather than seek excuses after falling to Italy in Udine, ahead of two more severe tests to come.

item.title: Mildura Base Public Hospital caught duplicating feedback figures in annual reports
item.description: A Victorian hospital has been caught copying and pasting its compliments and concerns data, after failing to update figures across multiple years of its annual reports.

item.title: Cable car on Kunanyi/Mount Wellington included in draft recommendations, Right to Information documents show
item.description: The Tasmanian government has made a draft recommendation for a cable car on Hobart's Kunanyi/Mount Wellington, documents released under Right to Information laws show.

item.title: Exhibition depicting Geraldton homelessness shown at Canberra's Parliament House
item.description: A portrait exhibition of people who have experienced homelessness is opening up conversations to show everyone has a story worth listening to.

item.title: Why Oscar Piastri was handed a 10-second penalty during the F1 São Paulo Grand Prix
item.description: Oscar Piastri was involved in the biggest flashpoint of the Formula 1 São Paulo Grand Prix, earning him a costly penalty and damaging his chances of winning the drivers' championship.

item.title: More than 2,800 US flights cancelled in a day as government shutdown persists
item.description: More than 2,800 domestic flights are cancelled in the United States over the course of a single day due to an ongoing shortage of air traffic controllers.

item.title: F1 drivers' standings: Oscar Piastri trails Lando Norris by 24 points after Brazil
item.description: Here is how the Formula 1 drivers' championship standings are poised heading into the final three rounds of the season.

item.title: Eastern ground parrot found in Narawntapu National Park, Tasmania
item.description: The presence of an endangered and "cryptic" parrot species at a northern Tasmanian national park is hailed as "very good news" by a bird expert.

item.title: RBA warns economy in danger of being trapped in slow growth lane indefinitely
item.description: The central bank's deputy governor says it's "more plausible" to wonder whether rates can go much further than to forecast further cuts. He says unless Australia's economic capacity lifts, the economy will struggle to grow without generating inflation.

item.title: Princess Anne remembers Porepunkah police officers in wreath-laying ceremony in Melbourne
item.description: The Princess Royal attended a ceremony at the Police Memorial in Melbourne as part of her official visit to Australia.

item.title: French 'Fedora man' pictured at Louvre heist scene unmasked as teenager
item.description: A 15-year-old is unmasked as the "Fedora man" in a viral image taken outside the Louvre on the day of the crown jewels heist.

item.title: This street is home to two cities with opposite laws and politics
item.description: These two US cities share a name and a main street, but come election time, following the rules on one side of the road could land you in jail on the other.

item.title: Connor Mathiasson jailed for culpable driving after Elise Hodder killed outside rave in Kooyong
item.description: A grieving father whose daughter was killed in a "catastrophic" crash says more needs to be done to deter young men from behaving dangerously behind the wheel.

item.title: US Senate votes in favour of bill to end federal government shutdown
item.description: The US Senate votes in favour of ending the longest government shutdown in the country's history, which has lasted for 40 days.

item.title: Emergency department waits of 35 hours for some SA mental health patients, AMA warns
item.description: About 10 per cent of mental health patients in South Australian hospital emergency departments are being kept waiting "more than 35 hours" for a bed, the AMA says.

item.title: Donald Trump booed at NFL game between Washington Commanders and Detroit Lions
item.description: Donald Trump is booed by sections of the crowd as he becomes the first sitting US president to attend a regular-season NFL game in nearly half a century.

item.title: The trams that made Melbourne: Celebrating 140 years since the city's first cable tram
item.description: Melbourne's history with trams goes back 140 years. The city got its first tram in 1885 and the fleet has grown to become the world's largest tram network.

item.title: Boy, 8, dies after being found unresponsive in pool near Shepparton
item.description: A child has died after being found unresponsive in a pool in northern Victoria.

item.title: Richmond set to host 'home' AFL fixture in Tasmania for the first time in club's history
item.description: Richmond will run out for a home game in Tasmania for the first time in its history next season in a decision the club says it has not taken lightly.

item.title: The AFL's Wildcard Round has been met with negative reviews, so why does it exist?
item.description: Footy fans are not impressed with the AFL's new finals-extending Wildcard Round, but it is all part of Andrew Dillon's grand plan for total domination of Australian sport.

item.title: Australian music legend Paul Kelly on his new album Seventy
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Surging floodwaters as Super Typhoon Fung-wong hits Philippines
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Ian Leavers, former Queensland police union boss, found dead at Brisbane home
item.description: The state's first cross-border commissioner was found dead at his home on Monday morning. Police say his death is not being treated as suspicious.

item.title: Bradley Wayne Wilkinson jailed for 16 years over road rage manslaughter of Rhyce Harding
item.description: A driver has been handed a 16-year jail sentence after he "used his vehicle as a weapon" to cause the tragic death of Rhyce Harding in Sydney's west.

item.title: NSW to review inmate classifications following prison guard bashing
item.description: The Commissioner of Corrective Services will undertake a review of inmate classifications after the assault of four prison guards earlier this year.

item.title: Father of seven-year-old neglect victim denied bail while awaiting sentencing
item.description: A man whose young son died after his pneumonia was left untreated is refused bail ahead of his sentencing for criminal neglect, with a judge noting his history of being "persistently non-compliant" while on supervised bail. WARNING: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander readers are advised this article contains the name of a person who has died.

item.title: Social media attack on Sydney MPs who condemned Neo-Nazi rally reported to police
item.description: The federal Member for Wentworth and the NSW Member for Vaucluse posted to social media denouncing the antisemitic rally by Neo-Nazis in Sydney, and offensive messages they received in response have been flagged with police.

item.title: On the Myanmar-Thailand border, bombing a scam centre could barely dent the industry
item.description: Myanmar junta bombing of a scam centre is little more than "political theatre" to appease the international community, an expert says.

item.title: Logan man Umar Al Enizi cleared of murder after Browns Plains road rage incident in 2021
item.description: A man accused of intentionally running down another man during a road rage incident in 2021 has been cleared of murder by a jury in the Supreme Court in Brisbane.

item.title: South Korea's former president accused of provoking military conflict with North Korea
item.description: Yoon Suk Yeol attempted to provoke military conflict between South and North Korea in order to declare martial law, a prosecutor's spokesperson tells a briefing.

item.title: Lions are 'unrelenting' and yet again the underdogs for this finals series
item.description: The Brisbane Lions secured a spot in their sixth consecutive preliminary with a win over Melbourne on the weekend. Yet with North Melbourne's dominance, the Queenslanders are "underdogs" in the race for the flag once again.

item.title: Cairns woman Toyah Cordingley killed on beach after 'confrontation' with former nurse, court told
item.description: Toyah Cordingley was "doing something that she would always do", exercising along a secluded Far North Queensland beach when she was violently killed seven years ago, a court in Cairns has been told.

item.title: Family and police appeal for information linked to Brandon Yates's fatal stabbing
item.description: Police launch a public appeal to help find the killer of 28-year-old man who died from stab wounds in Wollongong's main street.

item.title: Spirit of Tasmania operator TT-Line deemed 'insolvent' in August, but board disagrees
item.description: A report by Tasmania's auditor-general pointing out the financial challenges facing TT-Line show the ferry operator was insolvent in August, despite a $400 million increase in its borrowing capacity.

item.title: Canberra man given three-year sentence for sexual offences against 11-year-old girl
item.description: Canberra man Shegu Bobb has been sentenced in the ACT Supreme Court for a series of sexual offences against an 11-year-old girl, after a jury found him guilty earlier this year.

item.title: Fatal e-scooter crash death prompts renewed road rule debate in SA
item.description: Changes to road rules allowing e-scooters to be used on some public roads in South Australia are the subject of renewed debate, following the death of a man using one of the devices.

item.title: Mark Parton elected as new Canberra Liberals leader
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Police respond to reports of machete-wielding male in Alice Springs shopping centre
item.description: Northern Territory police are responding to multiple reports of a person armed with a machete at the Yeperenye Shopping Centre in Alice Springs.

item.title: Redress scheme opens for 3,000 Stolen Generations survivors in WA
item.description: Survivors of the Stolen Generations in Western Australia can now apply for $85,000 in compensation as part of a government redress scheme.

item.title: Homicide detectives speak to two adults following death of one-year-old boy in Ballarat
item.description: Detectives from the homicide squad have spoken to two adults following the death of a one-year-old boy in regional Victoria.

item.title: Cameron Green to test reworked bowling action in Sheffield Shield clash ahead of Ashes
item.description: Australia is hopeful that a slight adjustment to Cameron Green's bowling action allows the star all-rounder to have a big say in this summer's Ashes campaign and beyond.

item.title: If your child wants an e-bike or e-scooter, this is what you need to know
item.description: E-bikes and e-scooters might sound like an exciting gift for a teenager or child, but experts say there are several things to consider before buying one.

item.title: Woman and child drown in Dandenong Creek in Melbourne's south-east
item.description: Police believe a woman went to the aid of a child drowning in the creek, before also getting into difficulty on Monday afternoon.

item.title: A leaked memo brought down two senior BBC bosses — here's what it said
item.description: A leaked memo to the BBC's editorial standards board has dominated headlines in Britain and led to the resignations of two board members. Here's a look at what has happened and how the bosses responded.

item.title: Who is Jay Weatherill, Australia's new high commissioner to the UK?
item.description: Australia's next high commissioner to the United Kingdom's time in politics was defined by consultative leadership, pizza politics and a gatecrashed press conference.

item.title: Measles warning issued for South West and Great Southern as confirmed case numbers climb
item.description: Authorities and experts urge people in the state's south to be on alert for measles as the number of community transmission cases continues to climb.

item.title: Cudlee Creek bushfire class action trial begins in SA's Supreme Court
item.description: Victims of the devastating 2019 Cudlee Creek bushfire, which caused more than $200 million in damage, are seeking compensation from SA Power Networks, alleging the electricity distributor was negligent in the lead-up to the blaze.

item.title: Family of murdered backpacker Simone Strobel still seeking answers 20 years after death
item.description: The family of German backpacker Simone Strobel says a second inquest into her death has failed to bring them answers about how and why she died on holiday in NSW 20 years ago.

item.title: Nampijinpa Price pulls out of Put Australia First rally appearance with far-right activist Tommy Robinson
item.description: Jacinta Nampijinpa Price was due to speak at the Put Australia First event later this month alongside Tommy Robinson, a one-time member of a fascist political party.

item.title: Monday finance with Daniel Ziffer
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Mitchell Starc fires Ashes warning in Sheffield Shield return as Jake Weatherald and Beau Webster fail to fire
item.description: Mitchell Starc enjoys a successful return to red ball cricket while representing New South Wales but Jake Weatherald and Beau Webster fail to grab their opportunities.

item.title: Global humanitarian Alison Thompson awarded 2026 Australian of the Year for NSW
item.description: Alison Thompson was working as an investment banker in New York City when the planes hit the twin towers. She has since powered a global humanitarian movement and today has been recognised for her work.

item.title: Push for a ban on using ‘doulas’ during childbirth
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: NSW Police say a "communication error" led to Neo-Nazi protest being authorised by police
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: CCTV footage of a youth wielding a machete at the Yeperenye Shopping Centre in Alice Springs.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Donald Trump pardons Rudy Giuliani and others involved in trying to overturn 2020 election
item.description: The US president has pardoned his former lawyer Rudy Giulian and others who were involved in trying to overturn the 2020 election.

item.title: Former French president Nicolas Sarkozy from prison pending appeal
item.description: Sarkozy became the first former French president to be sent to prison in modern times, this September.

item.title: Thailand suspends peace deal with Cambodia after landmine blast near border
item.description: The peace deal between the two countries was overseen by US President Donald Trump.

item.title: Eight people dead and multiple injured after car explosion near Delhi's historic Red Fort
item.description: Police say the explosion came from a car parked outside the city's 17th Century Red Fort area.

item.title: Trump threatens to sue 'corrupt' BBC for $1.5 billion over 'salacious' documentary
item.description: Lawyers for the US president warn Britain's national broadcaster they are preparing to sue it over "fabricated" statements that aired in its Panorama program last year.

item.title: Infrastructure Victoria calls for upgrade to 'unreliable and infrequent' Upfield train line in Melbourne's north
item.description: In one booming growth area, north of Melbourne, locals are forced to drive to avoid long delays for trains during peak periods. Multiple groups are calling on the state government to upgrade its services.

item.title: Early childhood professors release six-point plan to fix 'broken' childcare system
item.description: Some of Australia's leading early childhood education professors join forces to release a six-point action plan to help fix the country's "broken" childcare system.

item.title: A damning memo shows the BBC's issues are bigger than its coverage of Donald Trump
item.description: It is not US President Donald Trump who represents the biggest political threat to the BBC, but a leaked 8,000-word letter of complaint to the broadcaster's board motivated by "despair at inaction".

item.title: The faces with a front-row seat to history
item.description: After Gough Whitlam was sacked, a crowd formed. They could have stormed the building. Fifty years on, this photo tells the story of The Dismissal.
